In the icy realm of the Arctic, a polar bear named Tundra dreamt of warmth. Unlike his kin, who thrived in the cold, Tundra adored the sun's golden rays. Each day, he would venture to the edge of the ice, stretching out on the warm rocks, soaking in the sunlight. The other bears teased him, calling him "Sunbear." One fateful summer, as the ice began to melt, Tundra discovered a hidden beach where the sun shone bright. He invited his friends to join him, and soon, they all learned to appreciate the warmth, transforming their icy world into a sunlit paradise.
